com.interwoven.teamsite.nikon.components.gallery
Class ThumbnailRenderer

java.lang.Object
  com.interwoven.teamsite.nikon.components.gallery.ThumbnailRenderer

public class ThumbnailRenderer
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
nbamford This Java class is a call out class for a Live Site Component. It takes in some parameters and returns an XML (Dom4j) Document. Its primary purpose is to scan a directory for images and return the XML required for the Livesite component to be able to render these images. To achieve this it needs the following information which is passed from the Livesite component as parameters wrapped in the RequestContext Parameter Description ========= =========== gallerySourceDCR This is the source of the default DCR bound to the gallery_component. maxImagesPerRow This is set on the gallery_component and is the number of images per row to display. maxHeight This is the maximum height in pixels to display the thumbnail. The browser will do the scaling maxWidth This is the maximum width in pixels to display the thumnbail. The browser will do the scaling fileFilter This is a csv list of file extensions to accept as valid picture name types. i.e. .jpg, .gif would look for jpgs and gifs How it works ============ The gallery_component is configured to call the method getThumbnails and the framework wraps the configured parameters into the RequestContext. In stand alone mode I fake the values so that we can see the XML which is produced. Talking of which, the format is as the following. The root element Response has a repeating elemnt of ImageRow which corresponds to the number of rows to display. Within ImageRow there are a number (up to a maximum of maxImagesPerRow) ThumbnailImage ThumbnailImage has a number of attributes which are scaledWidth - The scaled width of the image, this will depend on either the maxHeight or maxWidth depending on wheter the image is in portrait or landscape format scaledHeight - The scaled height of the image, this will depend on either the maxHeight or maxWidth depending on wheter the image is in portrait or landscape format path - Physical location of the image on the file system vPath - Internal teamsite virtual path to the image's folder fileName - Name of the image vPathFileName - Virtual location of the image within TeamSite portrait - true if the image height is greater than the width otherwise false width - Actual width of the image, determined via inspecting the image height - Actual height of the image, determined via inspecting the image If we haven't enough images up to the maxImagesPerRow then empty data will be passed in order for blank surrounds to be shown Enhancements ============ Currently the sorting of the images is arbitrary, it maybe be neccessary to dictate this order via some meta information. Talking of which no meta data is loaded about the image (this may be needed also), all depends on the hand Media Bin is taking and is still TBD. The file type filtering could be made more robust and extensive, perhaps using regular expressions to match on instead of simple Strings.
